data.name: Move the SVG!
data.description:
Hello potential coders,

I have just spent 15minutes drawing what I believe to be the perfect Cloud shape in Codepen. However I've now realised it's been drawn too close to the edges of the parent SVG!!! There are far too many commands for me to manually go through and change each value - let's write a function I can use.

The function will need to be able to move all SVG commands (i.e. M, m, A, a, S, s...), both absolute and relative, so whenever I decide to make my next cloud I don't run into the same problem.

The input will be the "d" attribute of the path element, followed by the number of pixels the SVG needs to be moved in the x and y direction. Assume all inputs will be valid.

```JavaScript
moveSVG(dAttribute, 
        x, 
        y)
```
The path command may or may not have a space after it and the values may be separated either by a space or a comma as both work in the browser. However, please give your answer as a space separated string.

```JavaScript     
moveSVG("M 30,20 L50 60 L60.542,20",
        20, 
        40)
        
//----> "M 50 60 L 70 100 L 80.542 60"
```

You can see your code in action by pasting the before and after d attributes into the respective path elements at:

https://codepen.io/pen/KQvZKe

Read up on SVG path commands here:

https://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathDataMovetoCommands
